subject: Education
title: Flashcards Done Right
description: A micro-lesson that makes Flashcards Done Right usable.

hook.text: Most people use flashcards wrongâ€”flipping too fast, never shuffling, and quitting too soon.

buildup.text: Flashcards work because they force active recallâ€”retrieval from memory, not passive review.

discovery.text: Key rules: answer before flipping, shuffle the deck, and keep cards you got right in rotation.

twist.text: Dropping 'easy' cards too soon starves them of the spaced repetition they need.

climax.text: Digital flashcard apps with built-in spacing algorithms outperform paper cards significantly.

punchline.text: A flashcard is only as good as the struggle to answer it.

quiz.question: What is the most common mistake people make with flashcards?
options: Dropping 'easy' cards from rotation too soon
Using too many colors on each card
Writing too much information on each card
